articles.headline: Familiar Names at the Store Want You to Stay With Them, Too
articles.snippet: With purveyors of luxury goods in the lead, retailers are entering the hotel business as one more way to market their wares.
articles.abstract: With purveyors of luxury goods in the lead, retailers are entering the hotel business as one more way to market their wares.
articles.lead_paragraph: Inside a Brooklyn warehouse that has been converted to office and design space are the seeds of a new type of collaboration between the hospitality and retailing industries.

articles.headline: Trump’s New Travel Ban Blocks Migrants From Six Nations, Sparing Iraq
articles.snippet: The new restriction will apply to citizens of six predominantly Muslim nations in an effort to improve on a hastily drawn order in January that did not pass legal scrutiny.
articles.abstract: The new restriction will apply to citizens of six predominantly Muslim nations in an effort to improve on a hastily drawn order in January that did not pass legal scrutiny.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump signed an executive order on Monday blocking citizens of six predominantly Muslim countries from entering the United States, the most significant hardening of immigration policy in generations, even with changes intended to blunt legal and political opposition.

articles.headline: Sterling Jewelers Suit Casts Light on Wider Policies Hurting Women
articles.snippet: Employee hotlines, mandatory arbitration and “tap on the shoulder” promotions can mask problems in workplaces, lawyers and academics who specialize in gender discrimination say.
articles.abstract: Employee hotlines, mandatory arbitration and “tap on the shoulder” promotions can mask problems in workplaces, lawyers and academics who specialize in gender discrimination say.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sandra Sargent had finally had enough when a guard at Jared the Galleria of Jewelry in Crestview Hills, Ky., waved his security scanning wand over her buttocks one day in 2007. Several weeks earlier, she said, he had used the same device to brush across her chest. So she called an anonymous company hotline and reported his behavior.

articles.headline: House Republicans Unveil Plan to Replace Health Law
articles.snippet: The plan scraps the mandate for most Americans to have health insurance in favor of a new system of tax credits to induce people to buy insurance on the open market.
articles.abstract: The plan scraps the mandate for most Americans to have health insurance in favor of a new system of tax credits to induce people to buy insurance on the open market.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Republicans unveiled on Monday their long-awaited plan to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, scrapping the mandate for most Americans to have health insurance in favor of a new system of tax credits to induce people to buy insurance on the open market.
articles.byline: By Robert Pear and Thomas Kaplan

articles.headline: The Trump-SoftBank-Saudi Connection
articles.snippet: Masayoshi Son’s SoftBank Vision Fund could be described as a front for Saudi Arabia, and a contradiction to President Trump’s nationalistic rhetoric.
articles.abstract: Masayoshi Son’s SoftBank Vision Fund could be described as a front for Saudi Arabia, and a contradiction to President Trump’s nationalistic rhetoric.
articles.lead_paragraph: As camera lights flashed, President-elect Donald J. Trump strode across the lobby of Trump Tower with Masayoshi Son, the colorful Japanese entrepreneur, in December.

articles.headline: Trump’s Wiretapping Claims Puncture Veneer of Presidential Civility
articles.snippet: After a cordial transfer of power, President Trump and former President Barack Obama have publicly criticized each other to an unusual degree.
articles.abstract: After a cordial transfer of power, President Trump and former President Barack Obama have publicly criticized each other to an unusual degree.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When last they saw each other six weeks ago after the ceremonial passing of power, President Trump and former President Barack Obama parted with smiles and handshakes. But it did not take long for the surface bonhomie to degenerate into a fierce and public clash unlike any other in modern times.

articles.headline: Inquiry Opens Into How a Network of Marines Shared Illicit Images of Female Peers
articles.snippet: A secret all-male group is being investigated after revelations that it had shared thousands of naked and private photos of Marine Corps women.
articles.abstract: A secret all-male group is being investigated after revelations that it had shared thousands of naked and private photos of Marine Corps women.
articles.lead_paragraph: Some photographs show female Marines posing topless in their dress uniform slacks, or with their camouflage blouses open, in pictures they thought would forever be secret. Others show private moments swiped from their personal social media sites.

articles.headline: Trump’s New Ban Leaves Few Spots for Refugees, Even the Hunted
articles.snippet: A suspension of refugee admissions to the United States puts in doubt an Obama administration program meant to aid Central American children.
articles.abstract: A suspension of refugee admissions to the United States puts in doubt an Obama administration program meant to aid Central American children.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN SALVADOR — Veronica picked up some modeling clay, molded it into little human figures with her hands — and then dug holes into the sculpture’s face.
articles.byline: By Frances Robles and Kirk Semple

articles.headline: Trump Budget Proposal Reflects Working-Class Resentment of the Poor
articles.snippet: By protecting Social Security and Medicare while going after anti-poverty programs, the plan suits a constituency that strongly backed the president.
articles.abstract: By protecting Social Security and Medicare while going after anti-poverty programs, the plan suits a constituency that strongly backed the president.
articles.lead_paragraph: You could almost hear the gasps from both sides of the ideological divide when President Trump unveiled the outline of his first budget late last month, proposing to slice $54 billion from the discretionary civilian budget next year to pay for a beefed-up defense.

articles.headline: WikiLeaks Releases Trove of Alleged C.I.A. Hacking Documents
articles.snippet: The documents describe agency tools used to hack into smartphones and TVs, as well as to bypass encryption on programs like Signal and WhatsApp.
articles.abstract: The documents describe agency tools used to hack into smartphones and TVs, as well as to bypass encryption on programs like Signal and WhatsApp.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In what appears to be the largest leak of C.I.A documents in history, WikiLeaks released on Tuesday thousands of pages describing sophisticated software tools and techniques used by the agency to break into smartphones, computers and even Internet-connected televisions.
articles.byline: By Scott Shane, Matthew Rosenberg and Andrew W. Lehren
